intro: Rubus carpinifolius var. platyacanthus, commonly known as the flat-fruited blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to parts of Asia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are dark purple to black in color when ripe. Its flowers are white or pale pink, and it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. This variety is often cultivated for its edible berries and ornamental value in gardens.
